Key to the families of Monocotyledons
Key to the genera of Poaceae

source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Poaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1994). Poaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Lemma of upper floret smooth or granular but not boldly ridged, quite blunt
Lemma of upper floret boldly transversely ridged, tapered to a minute apical point
Panicle thicker than 1 cm (not including bristles), with branches of panicle developed, mostly 10–20 mm long; fertile floret separating from remainder of spikelet at maturity
Panicle thinner than 1 cm (bristles excluded), with branches not or hardly developed; spikelet falling entire at maturity
Perennial; leaves firm, mostly narrower than 4 mm; bristles generally about as long as spikelets
Annual; leaves flaccid, mostly wider than 5 mm; bristles generally considerably longer than spikelets
